question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Config parsing panic] Can malformed configs cause panics with partial state initialization leaving the node in inconsistent state? (High)
[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: load_seed()] [Seed parsing error handling] Can malformed hex seeds cause panics or produce weak entropy for RNG? (High)
[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: load_seed()] [Seed trimming bypass] Does trimmed_input properly handle all whitespace characters, or can special unicode bypass validation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [File creation race] Can concurrent file creation for mint.key or waypoint.txt cause race conditions or overwrites? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Directory creation TOCTOU] Is there a TOCTOU vulnerability between DirBuilder creating test directories and canonicalize() resolving paths? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [BCS serialization failure] Can bcs::to_bytes() fail for root keys causing incomplete genesis with missing critical data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: setup_test_environment_and_start_node()] [Temp path collision] Can TempPath::new() generate predictable paths allowing attackers to pre-populate test directories? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: setup_test_environment_and_start_node()] [Canonicalize symlink attack] Can canonicalize() be exploited through symlink attacks to access unintended directories? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Quorum store worker starvation] Can num_workers_for_remote_batches=1 cause batch processing bottlenecks affecting transaction throughput? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Quorum store poll manipulation] Can quorum_store_poll_time_ms=1000 (non-performance) or 3600000 (lazy) be exploited to manipulate block production timing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Proof reading thread limit] Can num_proof_reading_threads=1 cause proof verification bottlenecks delaying block commits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Mempool tick interval exploit] Can shared_mempool_tick_interval_ms=10 in performance mode cause excessive CPU usage or synchronization overhead? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Failover manipulation] Can default_failovers=0 (performance) or 1 (normal) be exploited to control transaction routing and censorship? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Broadcast limit bypass] Can max_broadcasts_per_peer=1 be circumvented to flood specific peers with duplicate transactions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [State sync deadline bypass] Can max_connection_deadline_secs=1 cause premature connection termination during legitimate slow syncs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_test_environment_node()] [Log file injection] Can attackers inject malicious content into validator.log to manipulate log analysis tools? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_test_environment_node()] [ChainId exposure] Does printing ChainId::test() reveal the test chain ID allowing attackers to identify test networks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_test_environment_node()] [Inspection service information leakage] Does the inspection service expose internal node state that could aid attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: setup_environment_and_start_node()] [Node inspection data correlation] Can aptos_data_client inspection reveal transaction patterns or validator voting behavior? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Build information leakage] Does printing build_information expose compiler flags, dependencies, or debug symbols useful for exploits? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Version fingerprinting] Can build information be used to fingerprint specific vulnerable versions for targeted attacks? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Struct: AptosNodeArgs] [Argument injection] Can command-line arguments be injected through environment variables or shell expansion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Struct: AptosNodeArgs] [Conflicting flag bypass] Are conflicting flags properly validated (e.g., test with config), or can they be combined to create undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Struct: AptosNodeArgs] [Required flag bypass] Can required flags be bypassed through non-standard argument parsing or environment variable substitution? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Stacktrace information leak] Does rstack_self::child() expose sensitive memory contents or execution state through stacktraces? (Medium)
